Title: AVP, Digital Marketing Platforms - Toronto, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
Individually we are people, but together we are Aviva. Individually these are just words, but together they are our Values – Care, Commitment, Community, and Confidence.
This role is focused on driving business results through the strategy and management of our enterprise digital marketing platforms, including our website. Some good foundational work has been established in this area. As we look to evolve our overall business strategy, there is an opportunity to continue building the long-term strategy for Aviva’s enterprise marketing solutions.
What you’ll do
Digital Platform Strategy
Lead the overall strategy and ongoing management of our enterprise marketing platforms. Overseeing the development of digital channel strategies that support the Aviva brand, as well as our key distribution channels including our broker partners. In particular,
Our website
Broker portal
Email via Marketo
Marketing technology
Web analytics stack
This includes establishing requirements, assessing options, and gaining stakeholder alignment on proposed solutions. The role will be required to consider both short term needs, as well as our longer term business needs and how our platforms will need to evolve to meet those needs. Ongoing management will require both a strategic lens as well as the technical expertise to guide the team on day-to-day tasks. Scope includes website, email, data integrations, CRM, marketing automation, and web analytics stack including analytics, tag manager and web attribution platforms.
Web Strategy
Drive forward a clear strategy for our main web property including audience focus, KPI’s, content requirements, Ui/UX and development. Oversight of accessibility requirements. Integrating various regional and other business requirements. Knowledge of AEM (or similar enterprise CMS) and website analytics is crucial. Management of Aviva’s web analytics suite of technologies as well as the evolution of measurement frameworks and attribution will also form a key component of web strategy for Aviva Canada. As well, management, growth and deployment of Aviva’s SEO strategy will form an important piece of the web strategy mandate.
Data Strategy
Working with business leads and other stakeholders to establish a data strategy and understand how this enables the marketing technology platforms. The role will be expected to guide IT and business teams through marketing data projects and requirements. The successful candidate will help the VP of Marketing evolve a marketing data strategy that will empower marketing and business teams across the organization.
Program Support
The role supports digital strategy for our affinity and partnerships business, as well as for our growing Direct business. This includes helping business partners manage digital assets on aviva.ca and for their digital advertising programs, as well as developing media and measurement strategies for advertising initiatives.
People Leadership
This role includes leading a team of 8-10 people that execute on our enterprise platforms including digital strategists, analysts, content managers, and developers. Strategic and executional leadership across the team will be essential to success. This includes prioritizing of key initiatives and leading your team in collaborating with numerous stakeholders. Understanding how to get the best out of the team.
What you’ll bring
Minimum 5-10 years experience across various digital marketing platforms
Minimum 3-5 years people management experience
Knowledge of AEM (or similar enterprise CMS) and website analytics
Experience in developing and implementing web strategies for complex brands.
Experience within insurance (or FI) an asset.
Ability to handle various stakeholders including product leads, IT, marketing managers, UX/design and vendors, in ensuring understanding and buy-in to proposed strategies that will drive the business forward.
What you’ll get
Competitive rewards package including base compensation, eligibility for annual bonus, retirement savings, share plan, health benefits, personal wellness, and volunteer opportunities.
Outstanding Career Development opportunities.
We’ll support your professional development education.
Additional Information:
Aviva Canada has an accommodation process in place to provide accommodations for employees with disabilities. If upon commencement of employment you require a specific accommodation because of a disability, please contact your Talent Acquisition Partner so that an appropriate accommodation can be arranged. This process applies throughout your career with Aviva Canada.

Title: Digital Marketing Assistant - Victoria, BC - Indeed.com
Description:
Position: Digital Marketing Assistant
Hours: 35 hours per week
Location: Victoria, BC
*
Overview:
We are looking for a Digital Marketing Administrator for our growing startup. The Digital Marketing Administrator should be able to work with our manager of marketing and digital media to launch marketing campaigns. Your duties will include performing market research, and working with data to bring forward new and creative growth strategies.
This position will be funded through the Digital Skills for Youth Program, please ensure that you meet the criteria for Digital Skills for Youth.
About Origen Air:
At Origen Air, we believe that nature always wins. That's why we've harnessed the power of nature to restore biological balance to indoor spaces.
We are an early-stage clean-tech company dedicated to scrubbing pollutants out of indoor air. We aim to maximize human health and productivity while significantly lowering our clients' energy costs. Our mission is to produce the most effective and beautiful living air purifiers in the world.*
*
Origen Air is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We value and celebrate diversity, and are committed to making an inclusive environment for all employees.
Roles and Responsibilities:
Assist our interdisciplinary team with campaign launches, management, coordinating, driving schedules and deliverables
Manage communication with external marketing vendors and respond or coordinate response to marketing requests
Assist with social media marketing activities, managing content creation, proofing, and posting
Creating graphic representations of data and translating complex research into easily readable content for stakeholders and other departments
Preparing digital marketing proposals and presentations based on company needs
You Have:
An undergraduate degree
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Ability to translate complex research into common language
Knowledge of marketing strategies, including continuing education of new marketing tactics and tools
Proficiency with word processing, spreadsheet and presentation software
Excellent computer skills with aptitude data tracking tools
Ability to quickly learn and process information
Organization and time management skills
A strong desire to learn, contribute and be a part of a growing company
Video editing skills would be an asset but not required
Basic graphic design skills would be an asset but not required
You Are:
A post-secondary graduate
Legally entitled to work in Canada (i.e. Canadian citizen, permanent Resident or person who has been granted refugee status)
Self-assessed as underemployed, meaning you are employed below your level of education, outside your field of study, or hold part-time employment
Interested in building the skills most valued in the future job market
Interested in environmental sustainability, workplace health and wellness, and client discovery and success
Able to work independently as well as part of a team
A self-starter with the ability to manage and execute with minimal supervision
Work Environment:
Origen Air has been incorporated for just over two years. As a young company, we are strongly committed to hard work, creativity, and having fun while producing results. Furthermore, there are opportunities to develop materials and work on projects depending on your interests.
As a small team, you will have the opportunity to work closely with our Chief Executive Officer, Chief Technology Officer and Manager of Marketing and Digital Media.
*
Job Types: Full-time, Permanent
Salary: $18.00-$22.00 per hour
Schedule:
8 hour shift
Monday to Friday
Ability to commute/relocate:
Victoria, BC: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (preferred)

Bachelor's Degree (required)

No

Title: Social Media Specialist - Toronto, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
At Kotn, we’re reimagining the way our everyday items are made and purchased, beginning with your wardrobe, setting a new standard for social impact and traceability. Founded in February 2015, Kotn has been featured in over 80 publications such as New York Times, GQ, Vogue, Elle, and The Wall St. Journal. Kotn was founded in Toronto by three best friends, who were fed up with compromising on quality, design, sustainability, brand experience, and price.
Kotn is looking for a Social Media Specialist to join our team and play a pivotal role in growing the social media presence of the brand. As an essential part of the team, you will be responsible for managing all of Kotn’s social media platforms. You will tell the brand story via compelling social narratives and optimize for what drives engagement and audience growth across the various social platforms. You will join the Brand Marketing team and collaborate with our Creative team as the social media expert for the company. This role reports to the Brand Marketing Manager and is an exciting opportunity; integral to the growth and success of Kotn.
What you’ll be working on:
Creative Strategy & Content Execution [60%]
Partner with the brand team to create plans and strategies for all social media aspects of campaigns to extend messaging across platforms
Identify best practices for platforms and create playbooks for future campaigns + launches
Pitch engaging and shareable ideas on a regular basis and produce content to create more social-first content
Shoot photos and videos for always on social content like behind the scenes, design details, team interviews etc.
Explore new and emerging social media platforms/opportunities and evaluate which Kotn should invest time and effort into
Build strategies for new platforms for the brand and collaborate with the creative team to launch new platforms
Ensure that all social posts are aligned with our brand voice
Social channel maintenance [40%]
Maintain the social media marketing calendar in Asana
Capture and post opportunistic social posts based off business needs
Collaborate with the creative team to ensure the Instagram feed is cohesive and clearly tells the brand story
Ideate, plan, schedule and publish the day-to-day postings across all social platforms, owning performance and impact on audience growth
Build community on our Instagram channel by responding to comments and dms
What you’ll bring:
Social Media Mastery
Understands the nuance of social media and how brands interact with their audience. You are brimming with creative ideas and a masterful storyteller on any social platform.
Excellent Written Communication Skills
You are a wordsmith with an understanding of how to create impact through warm and engaging interaction with our consumers.
Organization
A knack for navigating multiple priorities, you thrive in a setting where organization is required to ensure everyone has what they need.
Additional Requirements:
Experience in a social media related position at an ecommerce or fashion related company
Understanding of all social media platforms (e.g. Instagram, Twitter, Facebook, TikTok, Pinterest)
Experience building scalable social content, campaigns, and/or channels that clearly communicate the brand story
Strong ability to analyze and leverage data for impact and report on metrics to senior leadership
Ability to effectively manage multiple projects with ease and react to changing business needs
Positive attitude that loves to collaborate cross-functionally

Title: Marketing Data Analyst - Ottawa, ON - Indeed.com
Junior Marketing Specialist - Calgary, AB - Indeed.com
Description:
Company description
RV SnapPad, The World's Only Permanent Jack Pad. We sell motorhome accessories direct-to-consumer and to large distributor accounts. Our company is expanding rapidly in the United States and we are now starting to sell in the Canadian market.
Job description
The Junior Marketing Specialist will assist in all aspects of the marketing, graphics, web development and data management departments.
They will be expected to perform basic tasks within our standard apps and software, including G Suite, Adobe, WordPress, Shopify, and many more. Following their introduction to these tools, the Digital Marketing Specialist is expected to find ways of improving, optimizing and implementing meaningful changes across their various touchpoints.
The Junior Marketing Specialist may also be asked to perform other duties outside of marketing, including logistical management, product management, and shipping/delivery.
Core Competencies
Graphic Design
Print Media Development
Web Design & Development
Spreadsheet Management
Asset Management
Good Communicator
Open & Eager to Learn
Bonus Points for Video Editing and Social Media Management Skills

Graphic Design across digital and print mediums. Creation of digital assets, which will be the property of RV SnapPad.
Assistance with management of web properties. Implementing changes on Shopify & WordPress backends. Occasional work within landing page builders (Unbounce).
Creation, management and collaboration in spreadsheets. Using formulas to parse data and create visualizations.
Assistance with data management in Project Management Software (Podio), asset management within Google Drive and making further improvements to folder structures.
Learn about logistics for DTC brands, including ordering, fulfillment and shipping of product.
Communicate within our team chat software Slack. Be available to chat between 9am - 1pm.
Work within social media platforms, including Facebook and Youtube.
Work Conditions
Be expected to show up in person during the 3-month internship period. Remote work can be more flexible if full-time employment is offered.
Work 40 hour weeks, Monday to Friday, 9 am - 4 pm.

Title: Marketing Coordinator - Saskatoon, SK - Indeed.com
Description:
Vendasta’s Marketing Services team is looking for a Marketing Coordinator to add to the growing team. A Marketing Coordinator works to help local businesses establish and maintain their online presence. The ideal candidate for this role enjoys talking with people, understands the importance of online marketing, and has a working knowledge of digital marketing. A Marketing Coordinator will communicate with Partners through calls, emails, and provide an exceptional customer experience.
Responsibilities
Provide fast and effective communication with Partners, Clients, and Vendors
Answer inbound calls, emails, and etc. to support Partners and help them achieve their business objectives through Vendasta’s platform, products, and services
Educate partners and clients on the Marketing Services products and processes
Track completed and pending work within Vendasta’s task management platform
Provide world-class customer service for our partners and their clients
Maintain product knowledge
Work with local businesses on a regular basis to improve their online presence
Conduct onboarding calls with local businesses to gather information and execute the services ordered
Work with local businesses to assess and implement a digital marketing strategy
Coordinate and pass along feedback from Partners on product development suggestions, escalating issues as necessary
Explain reports outlining fulfilled services and proof of performance
Skills & Qualifications
1+ years experience in customer service
Proper phone and email etiquette; excellent written and verbal communication skills
Digital marketing experience for local business
Proficient knowledge of social media (Twitter, Facebook, etc.)
Exceptional organizational skills and attention to detail
Ability to work independently with minimal supervision and collaborate within a strong team environment
Independent decision maker; can take calculated risks and deal with ambiguity
Takes initiative to improve processes and try new things
A technical aptitude and an ability to learn new processes quickly
Considered Assets:
Experience in web design, usability and content optimization
Proficiency with WordPress and experience with Adobe creative suite (Photoshop, InDesign)
Knowledge of the Digital Advertising industry - able to speak to campaigns performance and navigate through the platforms
Experience running Digital Advertising campaigns on platforms (Facebook, Google, YouTube, Display network, Linkedin etc)
Knowledge of Google Analytics and metrics analysis an asset
Applicants will be considered for Marketing Coordinator and Technical Marketing Coordinator positions.
Technical Marketing Coordinators have a higher emphasis on technical communication regarding digital ads, websites, etc.

Title: Senior Marketing Manager - Toronto, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
Company description
At BikeExchange our purpose is to:
Fuel the passion for riding by making it easy to buy and sell.
We make it easier for people to find, research and buy all their cycling related needs, through our destination marketplaces. We support and connect hundreds of retail bike stores and brands around the world. We connect millions of cycling enthusiasts and potential customers.
Whether you need your next road bike, the first bike for a family member, a commuting bike or the latest e-bike we can always help. With over 1500+ brands and 600,000+ products, we help people find the right cycling product, as the single destination giving ease, convenience and choice.
Across 8 countries and four regions, we are the world's leading bike marketplace.
Job description
BikeExchange Limited (ASX: BEX) is an international company, founded in 2007 in Australia.
We bring together millions of buyers and sellers around the world for cycling purchases on our cycling dedicated marketplaces.
In February 2021 BikeExchange listed on the ASX (BEX: ASX) as part of its strategy to grow and scale the business globally. This phase of the business is an exciting chapter of growth and as a result, we are looking for a Marketing Manager to join us and take the lead on all North American B2B & B2C Marketing campaigns.
You’ll have a strong all rounder marketing background and be the kind of Marketer who loves to both strategise, plan & jump in to drive your projects to success leading a small team and partnering with key Bike Exchange members across the region as well as globally.
This is the start of a very exciting journey for us!
*
About this job
The Marketing Manager
in North America is responsible for developing, establishing and amplifying the BikeExchange brand “Where The World Rides” in North America by utilising and localising global brand assets. The role will be responsible to build, plan and execute on the most effective marketing activities across all channels (digital and traditional) to drive awareness, conversion and retention.
The role will have two direct reports and will work closely with the sales, ecommerce as well as sales & customer success teams.
A biking background (personally or professionally within the industry) is preferred but not essential.
What you’ll do
Be accountable for the successful positioning of the BikeExchange Brand in North America improving brand awareness, reach, conversion & retention
Plan, drive an execute strategic marketing campaigns leveraging Bike Exchange channels utilising global brand assets to meet regional growth goals and targets
Develop and communicate clear project plans for all marketing activities, deliver against milestones to achieve goals, contributing to long term strategic vision and process development
Establish and amplify the existing Team BikeExchange sponsorship to the North American market and & drive the growth of new partner & sponsorships.
Support the sales team on design and content needs to ensure a smooth delivery of brand campaigns
Utilising google analytics and other insights platforms to let your decisions be guided and informed by data
Partner with the e-commerce manager to coordinate product and brand activities
Collaborate closely with the sales, success teams to drive cohesive and effective customer conversations
Be part of a global customer team that makes Bike Exchange the ONLY destination people go to for all things bike.
In your toolkit
Experience with managing and executing B2B and B2C campaigns across multiple segments
Experience with Facebook + Google marketing and various relevant social media channels (Instagram, TikTok, Twitter). A proven track record of success in driving brand awareness and sales across these platforms with a keen eye for ROI.
A solid understanding of SEO and SEM and the ability to get “hands on” as it relates to driving positive change in both areas.
Experience planning, building, executing and scaling cross-functional marketing programs
Experience working and communicating with broad groups of stakeholders
Experience managing multiple projects at the same time, and navigating competing priorities and goals
Experience managing a small team as well as third party agencies
Experience using data and metrics to measure impact, draw insights and determine improvements
You are tech savvy & platform agnostic and can show us a thing or two utilising Tech tools and platforms to drive results and internal efficiencies
Ideally, you’ll be passionate about cycling and enjoy riding, racing, talking, watching cycling related stuff
What’s in it for you?
The chance to be part of our exciting growth journey as we scale up. You’ll have exposure to local and international brands, teams and industries
The opportunity for you to use your diverse set of skills while learning how to solve exciting new problems
Real flexibility. We understand and appreciate that people have lives outside of work, so our working arrangements are flexible and will stay that way after Covid restrictions are removed
The role is fully remote. If a North American office is established that is within commuting distance from the employee, there may be an expectation to be in the office on a flexible basis
All the tools, equipment and resources you need to be successful in your role
If you’d like to find out more about how you can bring your expertise to this exciting opportunity then reach out to us today! We are keen to add the right person to the team ASAP.
*
Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Title: Marketing Manager - Victoria, BC - Indeed.com
Description:
About FREmedica
We’re a fast-growing company that manufactures and sells disruptive wearable technology that is helping people with Lyme Disease to live a fuller life, symptom-free. This is a game-changing technology with a proven track record. We’ve even got some A-list celebrities that have recovered from their symptoms and they’re ready to talk about it!
About You
We’re looking for an experienced, dynamic leader that’s ready to take their career to new heights, and help us make a big difference in people’s lives. You’re a digital marketing expert, can write brilliant, persuasive, engaging copy, and you know your way around SEO, Social Media and Content Strategy. You understand the value of video and how to put it together. You understand how to support an Affiliate Network with excellent marketing tools and you are full of ideas. You’re a team player, will contribute to business planning and you’re also excellent at managing a budget.
You’re a self-starter, motivated to succeed and want to be around inspiring people. You love tracking results and making every dollar count. You’re a get-it-done person with the ability to be flexible and welcome ideas from an engaged team.
You’re experienced at working with agencies and provide clear briefs and direction and you’ll also have a creative team reporting to you.
What You’ll Receive
We’ll welcome you to the office and there’s also an option to work partially remotely too. Your compensation will be related to your experience and expertise, but will include profit sharing and participation in an option plan. We do offer a nice vacation and benefits package, too.
Interested? Tell Us More.
1. Tell us why this job intrigues you.
2. Tell us more about your experience and expertise.
3. Share a few examples of campaigns you’ve worked on and tell us what you personally contributed.
4. What does your dream job look like?
And naturally, you’re adept at using all kinds of software and nothing intimidates you. If you’ve got Hubspot expertise, that’s a real asset too.

Title: Digital Marketing and Education Coordinator - Edmonton, AB - Indeed.com
Description:
About us
The Canadian Skin Cancer Foundation’s mandate is education and awareness around the prevention and early detection of skin cancer. Our programs target children and youth in grades 5/6 and jr/sr high school.
With the support of volunteers from universities across Canada, CSCF organizes virtual presentations into classrooms across Canada.
The Digital Marketing and Education Coordinator, under the direction of the Executive Director, is responsible for the management and development of digital platforms used to execute and promote CSCF's education and awareness programs
With the focus on learning and presentations at Canadian Schools, Grades 5/6, on sun safety; CSCF provides presentations through Google Meet to over 10 000 students through virtual learning. We connect future dermatologist students from medical schools from across Canada to present virtually to grade 5/ 6 classes.
CSCF also promotes sun safety awareness through social media and develops multiple campaigns powered by Google ads.
Using digital fundraising platforms, CSCF solicits donations and sponsorships.
The job is is to maintain and maximize over 10 different digital platforms and ensure that we are using them to their greatest benefit to our organization.
Duties and responsibilities
Development of Google ad campaigns
Development of social media campaigns
Support the online management of donor databases in Canada Helps
Maintain scheduling software for multiple calendars in 5 different time zones
Website updates in WordPress
Develop of an e-commerce platform within the website
Development of Facebook donation platform

Expected start date: 2022-01-10

Title: Marketing Partner - Don Mills, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
About Us
The Kraft Heinz Company is one of the largest food and beverage companies in the world, with eight $1 billion+ brands and global sales of approximately $25 billion. We’re a globally trusted producer of high-quality, great-tasting, and nutritious foods for over 150 years. Our brands are truly global, with products produced and marketed in over 40 countries. These beloved products include condiments and sauces, cheese and dairy, meals, meats, refreshment beverages, coffee, infant and nutrition products, and numerous other grocery products in a portfolio of more than 200 legacy and emerging brands.
No matter the brand, we’re united under one vision:
To sustainably grow by delighting more consumers globally.
Bringing this vision to life is our team of 39,000+ food lovers, creative thinkers, and high performers worldwide. Together, we help provide meals to those in need through our global partnership with Rise Against Hunger. We also stand committed to responsible, sustainable practices that extend to every facet of our business, our consumers, and our communities. Every day, we’re transforming the food industry with bold thinking and unprecedented results. If you share our passion – and are ready to create the future, build a legacy, and lead as a global citizen – there’s only one thing to do: join our table and
let’s make life delicious!
Our Culture of Ownership, Meritocracy and Collaboration
We're not afraid to think differently. Embrace new ideas. Dream big. We empower our people at every level – from entry-level intern to senior leader – to own their work. We share a responsibility to think like Owners – to be mindful of the collective and sustained success of Kraft Heinz – which we apply to every situation, every day.
As part of Kraft Heinz, you're supported to grow and achieve. You’re expected to bring your authentic self to work every day, to lead with humility, and drive outstanding performance at every level – and you’ll be rewarded. You’re given opportunities to leave a mark and build a legacy. But you won’t do it alone. You’re supported by passionate teammates along the way, and our collective, collaborative spirit fuels our incredible progress.
General information
All posting locations:
Don Mills, Ontario, Canada
Job Function:
01 - Sales
Department:
01 - 01 - Sales Management
Date Published:
19-Nov-2021
Job Type:
Temporary
Description & Requirements
Role Overview
In this role- you will play a key role in driving meaningful- daily relationships with small format restaurants and convenience store operators in ‘Canada’ to sell KHC products directly to store-level. The perfect candidate will have a solid attention to detail and have the capacity to multi-task in a fast-paced environment. It’s vital that this candidate be curious- proactive- data-minded- and actively looking for ways we can improve the consumer journey/experience helping build daily relationships with our company. It’s as much about being able to effectively translate data/insights- as it is using incredible brand creativity and intuition to uncover inspiring storytelling- and ultimately- create amazing connections with customers.
We are driving transformation; the ideal candidate will thrive in uncertainty and be thrilled to help create the future.
The Marketing Partner position within the sales organization provides the candidate with an opportunity to develop solid business skills as a foundation for further career development within the Kraft Heinz company- which could include roles on the Retail Field-Sales Team- Food-Service Field Team- Customer Business Teams- and Marketing business units. This position will develop marketing skills- verbal & written presentation skills- analytical skills- and will allow the individual to apply concepts and tools that will develop core competencies such as ‘Business Savvy’ and the ability to simplify the complex.
This role is entrepreneurial in spirit and as a ‘Marketing Partner’ offers an exciting opportunity to grow KHC sales.
Responsibilities
#1 Priority: Sell- sell- sell!! No fear of failure- we’re looking for a hungry individual driven to sell online daily.
Create and maintain an online plan: promotional calendar- innovation- and cross selling mechanisms.
Drive Performance marketing and CRM initiatives.
Drive Growth- develop and implement creative solutions to drive and convert more users.
Responsible for acquisition of customer contacts- distribution of product to accounts- and reporting via internal systems.
Monitor and enhance online sales activity.
Manage- analyze and draw conclusions on specific ecommerce KPIs (number of customers- conversion rate- cart size).
Utilize fact-based selling tools and market information to secure new product distribution- presenting cross-merchandising ideas and identifying other opportunities for new sales growth.
Requirements
Completed University degree.
Passion for marketing and sales.
Knowledge of digital marketing and user experience that result in customer acquisition- retention and growth.
Previous selling- merchandising or customer service experience is preferred- but candidates with a passion for marketing and driving business results who are willing to learn are encouraged to apply.
Strong interpersonal skills and ability to deal one on one with customers effectively.
Strong drive for results and customer focus.
Intermediate Computer Skills (Excel- Word- Outlook).
Self-Driven. Ability to work independently with minimal supervision.
Living in territory preferred (Toronto- ON).
The Kraft Heinz Company is committed to a diverse and inclusive workforce. Job seekers with disabilities who require accommodation during the recruitment process or would like more details about accessibility should contact:
accessibility@kraftheinz.com.

Title: Digital Marketing Executive - Etobicoke, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
RTS Consulting - Automation has over 25 years of experience providing industrial System Integration and Control Solutions for manufacturing using “leading technologies” to achieve Manufacturing Operational Excellence.
We deliver Shop Floor Control Systems (via PLC/SCADA/Historians/etc) to SAP Manufacturing Execution System (MES) solutions via our in-house Controls Engineering and MES Consulting practices. We assist companies adopt new technologies (COBOTs, Cloud Analytics, AI/ML, AGV’s, etc) to achieve manufacturing “Digital Transformation” leading to an Industry 4.0 “Intelligent Enterprise”.
How you will spend your time:
Create and execute lead generation campaigns to attract qualified leads
Create supporting collateral such as landing pages, videos, and assorted
materials to convert leads
Build and manage an editorial calendar and content that attracts a qualified audience including blog posts, success stories, newsfeed etc.
Analyzing campaign results, conversion rates, traffic, etc. to help shape future marketing strategies
Make recommendations for enhancing effectiveness and improving marketing KPIs such as click rates, conversions, and engagement
Build and manage the company’s social media profiles and presence, including LinkedIn, and additional channels that may be deemed relevant
Track, measure and analyze all initiatives to report on social media ROI
Maintain and update RTS’s website (Joomla)  * Coordinate, set-up and attend trade shows

Extremely detail-oriented
Able to work and execute at a high level with minimal supervision
Excellent verbal and written communication skills required  * Self-starter who shows initiative and has a strong inherent desire for improvement

B2B marketing experience

Experience working with tools/software to create and edit video preferred
Experience with A/B testing tools and email marketing platforms

Title: Digital Marketing Specialist - Vancouver, BC - Indeed.com
Description:
Entity:
WELL Health Technologies Corp.
Position:
Digital Marketing Specialist
Type:
Full Time Permanent
Location:
Vancouver (Hybrid Remote & In-Office options)
Company Overview:
WELL is hiring and this exciting position can be remote, hybrid remote or an in-office role.
WELL Health is a publicly traded (TSX:WELL) hyper growth health technology company headquartered in Vancouver, Canada but with a total of 7 offices located throughout North America including Quebec, Ontario, and several US locations.
WELL is run by a proven management team lead by Chairman and CEO, Hamed Shahbazi a proven technology impact focused entrepreneur with over 22 years of experience leading high performance teams. He has extensive strategic merger, acquisition, and divestiture experience. He founded TIO Networks (TSXV:TNC) which was acquired by PayPal (NASDAQ:PYPL) in July of 2017 for $304 million and still serves as Broadband TV’s (TSX:BBTV) lead Independent Director.
Collectively the WELL management team have a broad base of experience covering multiple well-known companies beyond WELL and TIO including 360 Networks, Avigilon, the Brick, Goldman Sachs, HSBC, and KPMG.
The company is also supported by a rapidly growing, diverse and dedicated team that consists of over 2000 employees and healthcare providers working remotely and in 76 outpatient medical clinics and as mentioned 7 office locations throughout North America.
Our ratio of female to male physicians is 50/50. We also believe in the power of new and fresh perspectives on our business which is why 63% of our clinic staff is made up of millennials and Gen Z employees.
WELL strives to ensure that its workplaces are nurturing and safe, a place where diversity is empowered, and were we all feel part of a larger WELL Health family.
Some WELL facts:
General:
WELL offers the most comprehensive end to end patient services platform in Canada including primary, secondary, diagnostics, telehealth and specialized care.
WELL has over 2300 employees and healthcare practitioners worldwide.
Growth:
In Q2 of 2021 WELL reported a 484% year over year increase in revenue which included a 432% year over year increase in Virtual Services revenue.
~$400M Proforma Revenue run-rate
>400%+ Expected Revenue growth in 2021
Scale:
>$800M capital deployed in the acquisition of companies
>2000 healthcare practitioners at WELL providing care
Position Overview:
WELL Health is growing rapidly, and we need to grow our marketing team to meet the demands of our expanding business. We are hunting for a self-motivated, experienced and passionate Digital Marketing Specialist to join our tight-knit marketing team. The successful candidate will work and collaborate with a boutique-sized, passionate, and highly capable team to develop and implement digital marketing strategies. The primary responsibilities will be strategizing, planning, building/executing and actively managing performance ad campaigns, including but not limited to search engine advertising, social, etc.
WELL is comprised of many businesses. In fact in the last 3 years the company has completed dozens of acquisitions of currently operates over 25 separate businesses in 8 different business units. The successful candidate will be responsible for performance-based marketing campaigns spanning many of these different WELL owned organizations.
Key Responsibilities:
The right candidate:
Has experience doing needs analysis, defining objectives and strategies, then implementing, measuring and optimizing digital marketing strategies with performance in mind.
Loves and is great at working autonomously but also loves brainstorming, working with a team and working collaboratively to produce the best results.
Handles ad campaigns from start to finish. From working with clients to analyze needs and planning a new campaign to developing the campaigns and monitoring ongoing results, you own the entire process and are WELL’s go to subject matter expert on all things Performance Marketing.
Is up to date with the latest trends and best practices in Social Advertising, SEM and performance advertising.
Is an expert in the field of digital results-driven marketing.
Is experienced in effectively managing multiple business accounts and clients.
Is confident, tactful and has entrepreneur-level independence when speaking to internal clients.
Has superb time management skills and meets deadlines.
Is an excellent communicator with approachability.
Is extremely detail-oriented with a passion for precision
Has a data-driven mindset: Obsessed with quantitative results and optimizing.
Is proficient in data analytics and/or BI tools (beyond Excel)
Can objectively make decisions based on data and guide a business in how best to grow- whether it’s measuring paid, organic, social or other digital analytics.
Is comfortable developing business cases, budgets, and reporting to executives.
Can effectively run test campaigns and optimize ongoing campaigns.
Has a deep understanding of how to analyze different audiences, their needs, and how to communicate effectively through advertising.
Enjoys working in a fast-paced environment and produces high-quality work under tight deadlines.
Requirements:
Highly experienced with SEM, Facebook Ads, Instagram Ads, Twitter Ads.
Considerable experience with analytics & tracking tools like Google Analytics and Tag Manager.
Prior agency experience managing multiple ad accounts and ability to work efficiently while meeting and improving key KPIs.
Considerable experience in eCommerce advertising and remarketing.
Considerable experience with primary social ads platforms is an asset (Facebook, Instagram, LinkedIn, Twitter).
Excellent communication skills and ability to keep clients up to date on both reporting and suggestions on ways to further optimize campaigns.
Extremely technically capable but a highly strategic thinker.
Can work autonomously but also works well as a team and is good with giving and receiving constructive feedback.
Excellent English copywriting skills and strong ability to write sales copy for ads.
Exceptional organizational skills and attention to detail.
SEO experience and knowledge is an asset.
Experience with Hubspot, PowerBI or Supermetrics is an asset.
Work Perks:
We offer competitive remuneration
We provide all required hardware, software, and tooling
Highly Flexible Hybrid working structure with options to work from home and our HQ office in downtown Vancouver
Also, have the option to work from our downtown Vancouver office in Gastown
Please provide your portfolio with the application.
Thank you.

Title: Digital Strategist ($60-$70k) - Toronto, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
We are excited to be hiring a Digital Strategist to join our team!
Founded in 2016, Search + Gather (S+G) is a passionate digital marketing agency that specializes in helping startups, scale-ups, SMBs and enterprise businesses grow. We don’t stop until our clients get the results they came for by utilizing our years of expertise to get them there. We take pride in our work, having assisted many of our clients in achieving their funding goals and even helping them to become acquired.
People are at the heart of what S+G stands for. Being able to fulfill our client requests starts with our amazing team. S+G works with all team members to elevate their knowledge and produce growth plans with transparency and realistic goals. As we continue to scale, we want to utilize your skills and see you grow in new areas with a commitment to helping you achieve your career goals.
For the Digital Strategist role at S+G, we are looking for someone with 1+ years of experience and knowledge in paid social and paid search platforms, digital marketing, tracking and reporting, and client communication. We also want someone who is up for the challenges and opportunities that come with working for a scaleup, growth company.
Daily Responsibilities:
Working on ad platforms including Facebook Ads, Instagram Ads, LinkedIn Ads, Amazon Ads, Google Ads and Google Analytics to set up, understand and improve performance for our clients.
Acting as a trusted point of contact for our clients to discuss account performance, new ideas and next steps that need to be taken.
Developing positive relationships that reflect true partnership in achieving the objectives of the client’s business.
Pulling data from analytics platforms and/or CRMs, (including Google Analytics, SalesForce, HubSpot, etc).
Collaborating with our Digital Designers to develop creative ads that speak to the clients' brand and audience.
Help to grow startups, scaleups and enterprise clients through clever and strategic digital marketing.
Anticipate any potential issues for our clients and share these with the team.
What We’re Looking For:
1+ year of experience working on ad platforms.
Adaptability with a desire to learn and develop your skills.
Drive to continuously grow our S+G client roster and team.
The ability to time-manage and collaborate on multiple projects simultaneously.
Working within deadlines with a continued emphasis on project detail.
Strong communication skills both internally and client facing with a friendly demeanour.
Confidence in your work, especially during client interactions.
The ability to accept constructive feedback and apply changes where required.
Our Work Culture & Perks:
Remote work environment, with an office in the Junction, Toronto for collaboration days.
Comprehensive colleague benefits including life, health and dental.
The opportunity to grow quickly in your role and within the company.
Eligibility to participate in team profit sharing, (based on performance).
A strong emphasis on work/life balance.
3 weeks of paid vacation, additional time off during major holidays, and summer hours (half days every other Friday from May-August).
Professional development (online courses, mentorship, learning sessions).
Yearly educational allowance.
Fun monthly socials, both virtual and in-person.
Team meals and drinks on collaboration days.
Learn more about our team through Instagram @SearchGather
Schedule: Full time
Compensation: $60,000 - $70,000 annually, (dependent on experience)
Direct Manager: Managing Director + Co-Founder
Location: Toronto, ON (Hybrid)
At S+G we pride ourselves on inclusivity and working collaboratively with each of our clients and every member of our team. Having a diverse team with various backgrounds empowers us to share unique ideas to build strategies that guide our business. We present our clients with out-of-the-box approaches, while ensuring that we’re accountable and transparent with our results at every level. If you require any accommodations throughout the recruitment process, please contact our People & Culture Generalist, Jasmine Michaelis.
Sound like the place for you? Join us in our journey as we continue to grow!
We appreciate and thank all applicants for taking the time to apply, however only those selected will be contacted to move forward.

Salary: $60,000.00-$70,000.00 per year

Bonus pay
Benefits:
Casual dress
Company events
Dental care
Extended health care
